description: A GTK Jellyfin client, Thank you!
It looks good and works fine in general, but it can't pull content from "Mixed Movies and Shows" folders from my Jellyfin Server for some reason, please fix it.
summary: It can't pull content from "Mixed Movies and Shows" folders

description: Loving Delfin! It's responsive, pretty, and feels right at home with other GTK/Libadwaita apps. Unfortunately, I have the same problem as another reviewer "Luis", that is- Movies and Shows are simple to access, but other "Mixed" content libraries don't show up at all, other than occasionally under the "Continue watching" section. I hope that, eventually, playing content from mixed-type libraries will become just as easy. Other than that, Delfin absolutely beats the stock Jellyfin client (which just feels like a thin wrapper around the webapp). Definitely give it a try!

Works well, quite smooth, straightforward UI.

First adding the server was a bit confusing (mostly because the field is so small you may not immediately notice the issue), but NOTE that it implicitly adds https:// to the IP address you input, so if you're not using this, manually change it. 
You're not meant to add a server name, it's meant to pull this from the address. I ran into this issue first time, and I just thought the whole thing didn't work.
like the simple UI and very fast
I enter my server address, eventually I'm able to hit the apply button, but can't edit the server name field so I can't even add the server. Jellyfin connects without incident
Delfin looks great and runs faster than the default interface. Win!

Excellent native client for Jellyfin. Finally...
A lot of polishing needed. But I love it.
Very good Jellyfin client for Linux!
aguaante riverr muy buena aplicacion,y aguante riverrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr 9/12/18 la tenes adentroooooooooo
